subject: Re: [junit] I really have no ideas - confused.
msgSnippet: Your service method needs a request and response object, that s why you should use J2EEUnit or something similar since you have to create those object and
messageBody:
Your service method needs a request and response object, that's why you
should use J2EEUnit or something similar since you have to create those
object and instantiate and initialize the Servlet. That's what the
specialized servlet testing frameworks do for you. Of course you can test
your other methods with plain Junit.

BTW, when you subclass from HttpServlet you shouldn't overwrite service(...)
but doGet(...) or doPost(...).

Johannes

----- Original Message -----
From: "selena su" <selena.su@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, March 09, 2001 2:00 AM
Subject: [junit] I really have no ideas - confused.


> Dear Experts:
> As attached is my Java Servlet source file. I really have no idea
> how to go about to test my HttpDatabaseServlet.java ? ;(. Shall i use
> J2EEUnit or normal JUnit ? Since it's a normal without any request and
> response, so i will use JUnit to test it ?
> One more question, any ideas of writing the test cases for this
> class.
>
> Thanks,
>
